section.name: Installing SOD
section.p: SOD is currently distributed in tar and zip formats. Both contain the same content, but we want to keep everyone happy. After downloading the most recent version of the zip or the tar, whichever you please, unpack it with the tool of your choice. This will unpack something in a directory structure like the following:

If all of these things came out of the distribution, you should probably set SOD_HOME now. SOD's scripts use the SOD_HOME variable to determine where SOD has been installed on your local system so SOD can find its libraries. You can set SOD_HOME as an enviromental variable or in the run script you're going to use for SOD. To set it in the run script cd into the bin directory. If you're on a Unix like platform, open up sod.sh in the text editor of your choice. On Windows, open up sod.bat for editing. Near the beginning of these files is the SOD_HOME variable. It's currently set to '../' so you can run SOD from the SOD directory unpacked from the tar. Set the value to the directory SOD was unpacked to from the tar in your local filesystem. Now SOD can be run from any location which makes segrating results from runs easier. Once you've done that SOD is officiallly installed. If you're not too worn out by the heavy lifting involved so far now might be a good time to go on to the walkthrough to see various neat things SOD can do.
